Name: Advanced Early Dengue Prediction and Exploration Service (Project AEDES)
Method: Multivariate linear regression with step-wise procedure
Description: The tool is an automated information portal that uses climate, Google search, and satellite data to predict dengue outbreaks and identify potential hotspot locations for public health and local government agencies.
Base language: Python, vanilla web stack (HTML, CSS, Javascript, PHP), Mapbox API
Data input: Satellite imaging data from Sentinel Online Copernicus, Climate data from DOST-PAGASA, Search trends for 'dengue' and related terms.

Name: Aedes-borne Diseases' Environmental Suitability (AeDES)
Description: The AeDES (Aedes-borne diseases' environmental suitability) tool is a monitoring and forecasting system for predicting the environmental suitability for the transmission of Aedes-borne diseases like dengue and chikungunya. It utilizes calibrated ento-epidemiological models, climate models, and temperature observations to provide information for decision-makers in the health sector. The tool combines both deterministic and probabilistic forecasts to inform prevention and control strategies, as demonstrated by examples of the Zika epidemic and the current dengue outbreak in Central America during the COVID-19 pandemic
Data input: Calibrated ento-epidemiological models, climate models and temperature observations

Name: Anopheles Spatially Explicit (ANOSPEX)
Description: Mathematical model to simulate Anopheles mosquito dynamics, aiding in the development and evaluation of strategies to control malaria transmission, considering environmental factors and field data. It utilizes a grid layout to represent residential properties, with each property containing a house and two larval habitats for mosquito development.
Data input: Mosquito population dynamics, Hourly weather data

Name: Arboverse
Description: Arboverse aims to develop a web-based platform that will analyze and aggregate information concerning arboviruses, their vectors, and various environmental elements such as deforestation, human movement, and climate change. The goal is to gain insights into the factors contributing to arbovirus outbreaks. Project: Data science and genomic approach to mitigate arboviruses in the current era of climate change; Funding Support: Burroughs Wellcome Fund.

Name: Arbovirus Mapping and Prediction System (ArboMAP)
Description: A software suite to model and predict mosquito-borne diseases, particularly arboviruses transmitted by mosquitoes, six weeks prior to peak transmission.
Data input: Mosquito infection, Daily weather, Long-range weather forecast, Human WNV cases

Name: Bayesian Outbreak Detection Algorithm (BODA)
Description: The BODA algorithm is based on a Bayesian hierarchical model and is used to analyze the number of reported syndromes over time. The algorithm assumes that the number of reported syndromes follows a negative binomial distribution, with an expectation modeled by a log-link function.

Name: Bayesian Outbreak Detection Algorithm (BODA)
Description: The BODA algorithm is based on a Bayesian hierarchical model and is used to analyze the number of reported syndromes over time. The algorithm assumes that the number of reported syndromes follows a negative binomial distribution, with an expectation modeled by a log-link function.

Name: Chol-Out-EWS
Description: An open-source software application for community-level cholera outbreak risk prediction and feedback through early warning systems

Name: CLIMSEDIS
Description: A climate-sensitive disease forecasting tool

Name: Container-Inhabiting Mosquito Simulation Model (CIMSiM)
Description: A weather-driven dynamic life-table model of container-inhabiting mosquitoes such as Aedes aegypti.
Data input: Local meteorological data, Mosquito food availability, Availability of various breeding sites (containers) and Human demographic data
Country where applied: Australia, China, Columbia, Honduras, Malaysia, Puerto Rico, Thailand, United States

Name: Data-integrated Intelligent System for Health Adaptation (DISHA)
Data input: Global meteorological data, population data, environment and land data, national disease surveillance data, mobility data

Name: Dengue Disease Prediction and Diagnosis Model (DDPM)
Description: A dengue outbreak prediction model
Data input: Dengue data of Predict the Next Pandemic Initiative, Weather data

Name: Dengue simulation model (DENSiM)
Description: A Dengue simulation model based on CIMSiM
Data input: Ae. albopictus population output of CIMSiM, Temperature, Rainfall, Saturation deficit, and Human population data
Country where applied: Australia, China, Columbia, Honduras, Malaysia, Puerto Rico, Thailand, United States

Name: Disease Monitoring Dashboard
Description: The application to West Nile disease in the Mediterranean basin

Name: Early Warning and Response System (EWARS)
Description: Early Warning and Response System for dengue outbreaks

Name: EPIDEMIA
Description: An EcoHealth Informatics System for integrated forecasting of malaria epidemics

Name: Epidemiological Parameter Investigation from Population Observations Interface (EPIPOI)
Description: Analytical tool for temporal parameters from epidemiological time series

Name: Epigraph
Description: A computational algorithm, to design a universal swine H3 influenza vaccine

Name: Epigraph- Albopictus package
Method: Discrete-time stochastic susceptible / exposed / infected / recovered / chronic-stage (SEIRC) model
Description: An Albopictus-borne chikungunya outbreak risk prediction and stratification tool.
Model output: Vector abundance, Total number of infections, Outbreak risk

Name: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control Vibrio Map Viewer (ECDC Vibrio Map Viewer)
Hydrology, Entomology, and Malaria Transmission Simulator (HYDREMATS)
Description: Hydrology, Entomology, and Malaria Transmission Simulator

Name: IDExtremes
Description: A modelling tool to predict the probability of infectious disease outbreaks given compound extreme climatic events

Name: LIS-MAL
Description: Estimates of hydro-climatic suitability for malaria transmission in Africa

Name: Liverpool RVF model (LRVF)
Description: A dynamic, climate-driven model of Rift Valley fever

Name: LiverpoolMalariaModel (LMM 2010)
Description: Mathematical-biological model of malaria parasite dynamics using daily temperature and precipitation data

Name: Malaria Prediction and Planning Toolkit
Data input: Global meteorological data, population data, environment and land data, malaria epi data, health program and operations data

Name: Mapping Malaria Risk in Africa Low-end Information Tool (MARA LITe)
Description: Climate data and malaria distribution maps and estimated populations at risk

Name: Mosquito Gene Drive Explorer 2 (MGDrivE 2)
Description: A simulation framework for gene drive systems incorporating seasonality and epidemiological dynamics

Name: Mosquito-borne Viral Suitability Estimator (MVSE)
Description: An R-package that estimates a climate-driven mosquito-borne viral suitability index

Name: Open Malaria Warning (OMaWa)
Description: A dynamic model of some malaria-transmitting anopheline mosquitoes of the Afrotropical region

Name: OpenMalaria
Description:
A simulator program for studying malaria epidemiology and the impacts of interventions against malaria.

Name: Seasonal Climate Outlooks in Pacific Island Countries (SCOPIC)
Description: Seasonal Climate Outlooks in Pacific Island Countries

Name: Spatiotemporal Epidemiological Modeler (STEM)
Description: An Open Source Tool for Disease Modeling

Name: Stochastic Lattice-based Malaria model (SLIM)
Description: Assess the impact of ivermectin treatment of cattle and buffalo with standard and long-lasting formulations on the survival of wild Anopheles on Sumba Island, Indonesia

Name: Vector-borne disease community model of the International Centre for Theoretical Physics, Trieste (VECTRI)
Description: Community vector malaria model to simulate the spread of malaria

Name: Water-Associated infectious Diseases in India: digital Management (WADIM)
Description: The WADIM project aims to bridge the information gap on sanitation and waterborne diseases. It includes a smartphone app for reporting and mapping sanitary conditions and disease occurrences, satellite-based maps for flooding and cholera risk, an ADD risk model, in situ pathogen and sanitation data collection, and stakeholder engagement and training programs.

Name: Health- Responsible Access to Data for Analysis and Research (Health-RADAR)
Description: The platform collects, curates, and transforms data to facilitate Climate Sensitive Infectious Disease (CSID) modeling. It offers an open-source tool to analyze data related to various diseases in multiple African countries.
Regional scale potential: Botswana, Eswatini, Namibia and South Africa

Name: FloDisMod
Description: The team will utilize open-source software to simulate floods and storm surges, specifically focusing on the Southern Texas border area. The aim is to enhance understanding of their effects on mosquito habitats, disease reporting, social vulnerability, and health risks. The project involves developing an early warning system for the Texas-Mexico border region, with potential future extensions to include soil-borne diseases and other geographical locations.

Name: Ecohealth Rift Valley Fever forecasting tool
Digital technology for storm-related malaria response
Semi-automated data collection tool for arenaviruses
